message_1: Simplify the rational expression (4x^2 - 16x) / (12x^2 - 24x) as much as possible.
message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we first factor out the common factors in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator: 4x^2 - 16x
Factor out the common factor of 4x:
4x(x - 4)

Denominator: 12x^2 - 24x
Factor out the common factor of 12x:
12x(x - 2)

Now, the rational expression becomes:
(4x(x - 4)) / (12x(x - 2))

Next, we can simplify the expression by canceling out the common factors in the numerator and the denominator. In this case, the common factor is 4x.

(4x/4x)((x - 4) / (3(x - 2)))

After canceling out the common factor, we are left with:
(x - 4) / (3(x - 2))

So, the simplified rational expression is:
(x - 4) / (3(x - 2))
